titleStmt.title: Gadla Qirqos “Vita of Cyricus” / Taʾāmra Qirqos “Miracles of Cyricus”

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.title: Gadla Qirqos “Vita of Cyricus”
msItem.incipit: 3ra በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩አምላክ፡ ገድል፡ ወስምዕ᎓ ዘማር᎓ ወሕፃን᎓ ወሰማዕት፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወዜና᎓ እሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ። ወዘካልአን᎓ ሂ፡ እልፍ፨ ወአሠርቱ᎓ ምእት᎓ ፵ወ፬ሰማዕት፡ እለ፡ ተከለሉ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ እስክንድሮስ፡[sic] መኰንን። እስመ᎓ በመዋዕለ፡ ውእቱ᎓ መኰንን᎓ ኮነ፡ ዓቢይ᎓ ስደት᎓ ላዕለ᎓ አብያት᎓ ክርስቲያናት፡ ዘቂልቂያ፨… In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. Vita and martyrdom of the infant martyr mar Cyricus, and story of his mother Yulitta and of other 11,144 martyrs who were crowned during the time of the governor Alexander, because in the time of that governor there was a big persecution upon the churches of Cilicia.
msItem.explicit: 44va …ወናሁ፡ ማር፡ ሕፃን፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሀለወ፡ ወትረ፡ እንዘ፡ ይቀውም፡ በየማነ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ሕያው፨ ወይተነብል፡ ምሕረተ፡ በእንቲአነ፡ ወበእንተ፡ ኵሎሙ፡ ኃጥአን።…and behold, the infant mar Cyricus is always present standing on the right side of the living God, and he intercesses mercy for the sake of us and all the sinners.
msItem.note: There is presently an inconsistency in the text due to the misplaced quire (original quire 4 was inserted, in the rebinding process, after quire 1)

msItem.title: Taʾāmra Qirqos “Miracles of Cyricus” (12 miracles)
msItem.incipit: 45ra በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩አምላክ፡ ነዋ᎓ ጸሐፍነ᎓ ተአምራቲሁ᎓ ለሕፃን᎓ ቂርቆስ᎓ ከመ᎓ ኢይኩን᎓ ዝንጋዔ᎓ ለእለ᎓ ይሰምዐ[sic]᎓ ሰማዕያን፨ ጸሎቱ᎓ ወበረከቱ᎓ ወረድኤተ᎓ ወላዲቱ᎓ የሃሉ᎓ ምስለ᎓ ገብሩ᎓ ዘመንፈስ᎓ ቅዱስ᎓ ለዓለመ᎓ ዓለም᎓ አሜን፨ ወሀሎ᎓ አሐዱ᎓ ንጉሥ᎓ ጻድቅ᎓ ወካህን᎓ ዘተወክፈ᎓ ሢመተ᎓ ክህነት᎓ እምአፈ᎓ አምላኩ᎓ በሀገረ᎓ ሮሀ᎓ ቅድስት፨… (Introduction) In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. Behold, we wrote the miracles of the infant Cyricus in order that it would not be senselessness to the auditors who listen. May his prayer and his blessing and the help of his mother be with his servant Za-Manfas Qǝddus. For the eternity, amen. (Miracle 1) And there was a righteous king and priest who received the ordination from the mouth of his God in the saint region of Roha.…
msItem.explicit: 71va, l.10: (Miracle 12) …ሕፃን᎓ ቂርቆስ᎓ ባሕቱ᎓ ከመ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ፈቀደ፨ ለእለ᎓ ፀንሕዎ᎓ ሕዝብ᎓ በተስፋ᎓ ዕበየ᎓ ኃይሉ᎓ አግሀደ፨ ወሰገራተ᎓ እምቤቱ᎓ ሰደደ፨ … But the infant Cyricus, as he wished, revealed the magnificence of his power to the people who observed him with hope, and he expelled the guards from his house.

msItem.title: St. Cyricus and King in the region of “Roha”
msItem.incipit: በስመ፡ʼʼ… ነዋ᎓ ጸሐፍነ᎓ ተአምራቲሁ᎓ ለሕፃን᎓ ቂርቆስ᎓ … ወሀሎ᎓ አሐዱ᎓ ንጉሥ᎓ ጻድቅ᎓ ወካህን᎓ ዘተወክፈ᎓ ሢመተ᎓ ክህነት᎓ እምአፈ᎓ አምላኩ᎓ በሀገረ᎓ ሮሀ᎓ ቅድስት፨

msItem.title: Short hymn
msItem.incipit: በደመ፡ ስምዑ፡ ተማኅፀነ፡ ለአርዌ፡ ሰማይ፡ ንማዖ፡ ለቂርቆስ፡ ሶበ፡ ንጼውዖ። እንዘ፡ ትብል፡ ተካየድከ፡ አልፋ፡ ወኦ፨…

msItem.title: St. Cyricus and the monk from a remote region
msItem.incipit: ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ ጸሎተ፡ … ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ መነኮስ፡ ምስኪን፡ ወነዳይ፡ እምርኁቅ፡ ብሔር፨ ወይትመሐፀኑ፡ በኪዳኑ፡ ክብርት፡ ወይትአመን፡

msItem.title: Short hymn (Salām)
msItem.incipit: ሰላም፡ ለሕማምከ፡ ወለግፍዕከ፡ ብዙኅ፨ እንተ፡ ያብኪ፡…

msItem.title: St. Cyricus and the sterile couple who was supplicating to the saint for getting a baby
msItem.incipit: ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወሀሎ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እምአህጉረ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘይትአመኖ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ በኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወያፈቅር፡ ጾመ፡ ወጸሎተ፨ ወብእሲቱ፡ መካን፡

msItem.title: Short hymn (Salām)
msItem.incipit: ሰላም፡ ለህላዌከ፡ ማእከለ፡ ሰብዓቱ፡ ነገድ፨ እለ፡…

msItem.title: St. Cyricus and the monk ʾElyās
msItem.incipit: ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወሀሎ፡ ፩መነኮስ፡ በዛቲ፡ ደሴተ፡ ፃና፡ ዘስሙ፡ ኤልያስ፨ ዘይትለአከ፡ ወትረ፡ በመዓልት፡ ወበሌሊት፡ በትጋህ፡ ዘእንበሰ፡ ጽርዓት፡ ለታቦተ፡ ሕፃን፡ ቂርቆስ፡ …

msItem.title: Short hymn
msItem.incipit: እግዚኣብሔር፡ ሤመ፡ ረድኤቶ፡ ለንስዕናከ፡ ዓቃቤ፨ ወስምዖ፡…

msItem.title: St Cyricus and the poor woman who was selling the water
msItem.incipit: ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወነበረት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ነዳይት፡ ወትሠይጥ፡ ማየ፡ ለሲሳየ፡ ዕለት፨ ወባቲ፡ ለይእት፡ ብእሲት፡ አሐዱ፡ ወልድ፡ ንዑሰ፡ አካል፡ ዘሠለስቱ፡ ዓመት፡ ወመንፈቀ፡ ዓመት፨ …

msItem.title: Short hymn
msItem.incipit: ሰላም፡ ለቂርቆስ፡ እንተ፡ ኢፈርሆ፡ ለነድ፨ ዘይሰማዕ፡ ድምፁ፡ ከመ፡ ነጐድጓ፨፡…

msItem.title: St Cyricus and the son of a presbyter of the church devoted to him
msItem.incipit: ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወነበረ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአቡሁ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ውእቱ፡ ዘይትለአክ፡ ለቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘእግዝእትነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ወድንግል፡ በ፪ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ለዝንቱ፡ ወልድ፡ አቡሁ፡ …

msItem.title: Short hymn
msItem.incipit: አመ፡ ተመከሩ፡ ሰብእ፡ በደዌ፡ መከራት፡ ክልኤ፨ ወተስፋ፡ ድኂን፡ ቀብፁ፡ መንገለ፡ ኃጥኡ፡ ረዳኤ፨…

msItem.title: St Cyricus and the governor in front of the King
msItem.incipit: ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወኮነ፡ በ፩ዕለት፡ እመዋዕል፡ አስሮሙ፡ አሐዱ፡ መኰንን፡ ቅድመ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ለመንፈቀ፡ ካህናቲሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ መስተጋድል፡ በግፍዕ፡ በሐስት፨ …

msItem.title: St. Cyricus and the woman who had no husband
msItem.incipit: ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወሀለወት፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ አሐቲ፡ በእሲት፡ ነዳይት፡ እምንዋየ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ዓለም፡ ወመበለት፡ ይእቲ፡ ወትመከረት፡ በደዌ፡ …

msItem.title: Short hymn
msItem.incipit: ኢተሐልዩ፡ ዘትብሉ፡ ወዘት ነብቡ፡ ከመ፡ ለቀደምት፡ ተጽሕፈ፨ እስመ፡ ዮም፡ ለክሙ፡…

msItem.title: St Cyricus and the great ruler who was imprisoned
msItem.incipit: ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወሀሎ፡ ፩መስፍን፡ ዓቢይ፡ ዘተወድየ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ሞቅሕ፡ በትእዛዘ፡ ንጉሥ፡ እስመ፡ ዝንቱ፡ መስፍን፡ ለዝንቱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ወልደ፡ እሳቱ፡ ውእቱ፨…

msItem.title: Short hymn
msItem.incipit: ለመስፍን፡ ሙቁሕ፡ ብሥራተ፡ ፍሥሐ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንዋም፨ ከመ፡ አብሰርኮ፡ በሕልም፨…

msItem.title: St Cyricus and the strong wind from the west that destroyed the church devoted to him
msItem.incipit: ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … መጽአ፡ ዓቢይ፡ ነፋስ፡ በጊዜ፡ ስድስቱ፡ ሰዓተ፡ መዓልት፡ እመንገለ፡ ዓረብ፡ ወነሥአ፡ ተድባበ፡ ቤቱ፡ ለሕፃን፡ ቂርቆስ፡…

msItem.title: Short hymn
msItem.incipit: አስፍንቱ፡ አብያተ፡ ውቅሮ፡ እለ፡ ወድቁ፡ ወተመዝበሩ፨ ኀበ፡ ተዳደቆሙ፡…

msItem.title: St Cyricus and the sick man
msItem.incipit: ንዌጥን፡ በረድኤተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ክቡር፡ ወልዑል፡ ወበስነ፡ ሀብቱ፡ ጽሒፈ፡ ተአምራቲሁ፡ ወመንክቲሁ፡ ለሐፃን፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወልደ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ ቅድስት፡ … ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሕሙም፡ ዘኢይክል፡ ቀዊመ፡ ወየዓቅብ፡ …

msItem.title: Short hymn
msItem.incipit: አመ፡ ተመከሩ፡ ሰብእ፡ በደዌ፡ መክራት፡ ክልኤ፨ ወተስፋ፡ ድኂን፡ ቀብጹ፡ መንገለ፡ ኃጥኤ፨…

msItem.title: St. Cyricus and the pagans who waged a war against Christians
msItem.incipit: ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ … በአሐዱ፡ ዓመት፡ እምአዝማነ፡ መከራ፨ አመ፡ ኮነ፡ ድልቅልቅ፡ በበብሔሩ፡ እስመ፡ ጠፍአ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ራትዕ፡ ...

msItem.title: Short hymn
msItem.incipit: መኑ፡ እምክህለ፡ አድኅኖ፡ እምእለ፡ ገብሩ፡ ልማደ፨ ፍና፡ ሰርከ፡…

msItem.colophon: 44va l.7 ወናሁ፡ በዝየ፡ ተፈጸመ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ገድሉ፡ ወስምዑ፡ ለሕፃን፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ አምላካዊ፨ በረከተ፡ ጸሎቱ፨ ወሀብተ፡ ረድኤቱ፡ ወረድኤተ፡ ወላዲቱ፨ የሃሉ፡ [44vb] ምስለ፡ ገብሩ፡ ዘመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ ወአሜን፨ ለይኩን፡: Herewith, the book of the life and martyrdom of the infant Cyricus, divine martyr, has been completed. May the blessing of his prayer and the gift of his help and the help of his mother be with his servant Za-Manfas Qǝddus. For the eternity, amen and amen. Let it be. The colophon is followed by a short hymn (salām la-malkǝʿkā malkǝʿā madangaṣ mālākot...); s. 44vb, ls. 4-13.

supportDesc.extent: Made of 72.0 folios, of which blank 1r-2v, 71vb, 72r-v, in 10.0 quires ((A + 9)). 270 220 45

signatures.note: - Undecorated quire marks are written thrice in the upper margin (partly in the main hand, partly in a secondary hand) in fols.: 3r: ፩; 11r: ፬; 19r: ፪; 27r: ፫; 35r: ፭; 43r: ፮; 51r: ፯; 59r: ፰; 67r: ፱.

list.note: originally quire IV, as visible from the numbering
originally quire II, as visible from the numbering
originally quire III, as visible from the numbering
Quires 2, 3 and 4 are misplaced (original quire 4 is inserted after quire 1); according to the text and to the quires marks

supportDesc.condition: Quires 2, 3 and 4 are misplaced, possibly as a result of resewing.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling (below on 9r-v).
The bottom line is written above the ruling. A bottom ruled line has not been used by the scribe on 52r-v, 57v, 69v-71r.

list.item: nine dot asterisk (used throughout the text);
four nine dot asterisks (esp. fols.: 59va, l.16);

handNote.seg: Nomina sacra; names of the protagonists (Qirqos and ʾIyäluṭa); name of the donor. A group of lines alternating with black lines in the incipit page of Texts I and II; the initial lines of some paragraphs and some passages within Text I; the initial two lines of each miracle in Text II; Trinitarian formula; some corrections (words or letters) interlineally and over erasures. Elements of Ethiopian numerals, of punctuation signs, of text dividers and quire marks; marginal notes. Nomina sacra; names of the protagonists (Qirqos and ʾIyäluṭa); name of the donor. A group of lines alternating with black lines in the incipit page of Texts I and II; the initial lines of some paragraphs and some passages within Text I; the initial two lines of each miracle in Text II; Trinitarian formula; some corrections (words or letters) interlineally and over erasures. Elements of Ethiopian numerals, of punctuation signs, of text dividers and quire marks; marginal notes.

handDesc.handNote: Distinctive features: conspicuously right-sloping letters, thick vertical stokes.

decoDesc.decoNote: Fol. 4v: Julitta in front of the governor.Legend: ዘከመ፡ ይቤላ፡ እስክድሮስ፡[sic] ለኢየሉጣ፡ ስግዲ፡ ለአማልክትየ። “How (the governor) Alexander said to Julitta: ‘Prostate yourself in front of my god’”.
Fol. 7r: Cyricus being flagellated.Legend: ዘከመ፡ ተቀሥፈ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ “How Saint Cyricus was flagellated”.
Fol. 9r: Cyricus being tortured with mustard and salt put into his nostrils.Legend: ዘከመ፡ ወደዩ፡ ውስተ፡ አእናፊሁ፡ ሰናፔ፡ ወፄወ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ “How (they) put mustard and salt into Saint Cyricus’ nostrils”.

decoNote.desc: Cyricus being tortured by means of rods.
Cyricus and Julitta being in a hot cauldron.
Cyricus defeating Satan and the governor.
Cyricus and Julitta in front of the governor.
The Angel of God demolishing the simulacra.
Cyricus in front of the governor.
Cyricus and the meat multiplied by him.

decoDesc.decoNote: Fol. 27v: Cyricus’ tongue being cut.Legend: ዘከመ፡ ተመትረ፡ ልሳኑ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ “How Saint Cyricus’ tongue was cut”.

Fol. 32v: Cyricus praying on his mother (above); Cyricus and Julitta saved from the flames (below).Legend (above, left): ዘከመ፡ ጸለየ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ በእንተ፡ እሙ፡ “How Saint Cyricus prayed on his mother”. Legend (above, right): ዘከመ፡ ወረደ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ በአምሳለ፡ ርግብ፡ በላዕለ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ “How the Holy Spirit with the aspect of dove descended on Julitta”.

decoNote.desc: Julitta and the infant Cyricus (above); Cyricus and Julitta in front of the governor.

decoDesc.decoNote: Fol. 38r: Cyricus and the governor whose neck was in pain.Legend: ዘከመ፡ ቈስለ፡ ክሣዱ፡ ለእስክድሮስ፡ ከሃዲ፡ “How the infidel Alexander’s neck was injured”.
Fol. 41v: Cyricus and Julitta receiving the Covenant from the Lord.Legend: ዘከመ፡ ወሀቦ፡ ኪዲነ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወለእሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ እግዚእነ። “How our Lord gave the Covenant to Saint Cyricus and his mother Julitta”.

Fol. 43r: Beheading of Cyricus and Julitta and their crowning (above); the donor daǧǧāzmāč Sabāgādis (below).Legend (above): ዘከመ፡ ተመትረ፡ ክሣዶሙ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወለእሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ “How the neck of Saint Cyricus and his mother Julitta was cut”. Legend (below): ዘከመ፡ ተማኅፀነ፡ ደጅ፡ አዝማች፡ ሰባ፡ ጋዲስ፡ መኰንነ፡ መኳንንት፡ መስፍነ፡ መሳፍንት፡ አግዚአብሔር፡ ይዕቀብከ፡ እምዓይነ፡ ሞት፡ አሜን። “How daǧǧāzmāč Sabāgādis, governor of the governors, ruler of the rulers, received in trust, so that the Lord might protect you from the eye of the death. Amen”.

item.q: 2v: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘደጅ፡ አዝማች፡ ሰባ፡ ጋዲስ፡ መኰንነ፡ መኳንንት፡ መስፍነ፡ መሳፍንት፡ {ዘ}ወሀቦ፡ ለመቅደሰ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ዘአድ፡ ገራት፡ ከመ፡ ይኩኖ፡ ለመድኃኒተ፡ ሥጋ፡ ወነፍስ፡ አሜን።

2v: This (is) the book of daǧǧāzmāč Sabā Gādis, the governor of the governors and the prince of the princes, which he gave to the sanctuary of St Cyricus of ʾAdd Grāt, so that it might be the remedy for the flesh and soul. Amen.

item.desc: - The title ገድለ ቂርቆስ is written on 1r in red ink and in pen.
- Erasures marked by parallel lines over the word: 14va, 22rb, 48rb, 49vb, 58rb.
- Immediate corrections written over erasures on 3rb.
- Space left unfilled for the rubricated name of Qirqos on 65rb.
- Crude notes in pen or in pencil in the upper margin of fols: 64r and 69v and on 72v.

- Monthly readings are indicated by the names of the months written (in red, in frames or between lines above and below, in a secondary hand) in the upper margin: ምንባብ፡ ዘጥር፡: fol. 3r ምንባብ፡ ዘየካቲት፡: fol. 7v ምንባብ፡ ዘመጋቢት፡: fol. 10r ዘሚያዝያ፡: fol. 13r ምንባብ፡ ዘግንቦት: fol. 15v ምንባብ፡ ዘሰኔ᎓fol. 18r ዘነሐሴ፡: fol. 19v ምንባብ፡ ዘሐምሌ: fol. 23r ምንባብ፡ ዘመስከረም፡ fol. 25r ምንባብ፡ ዘጥቅምት፡: fol. 27v ምንባብ፡ ዘህዳር፡ fol. 33r ምንባብ፡ ዘታሕሣሥ፡: fol. 38v.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 6 tools were used: cross hatching, double circle, triple line fillet, criss cross, double sine wave with dots, double crescent).

history.provenance: Za-Manfas Qǝddus (the baptismal name of daǧǧāzmāč Sabāgādis, b. 1780/85, d. 1831; s. EAE IV, 430-31) is mentioned in the colophon, in Additio 1 and in the supplication formulas throughout the Ms. (e.g. 45ra, 47rb).

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
